main event: Two extremely bright and star-like objects, brighter than stars with a blue cast, moving at a high rate of speed were observed in Xenia, Ohio, for about 60-90 seconds.
interesting points: The objects were about the size of a nickel held at arm's length and vanished into the Southwest.
Flight test aircraft with testing anti-collision lights were likely the explanation for the sighting.

The handwritten commentary on the incidents related in the report suggests a recurring explanation for the reported phenomena, but the duration of the sighting (23:00) and the length of time from the sighting to the report receipt are undetermined.
The observer estimated the speed of the object to be approximately 1,200 miles per hour.
The observer, a civilian resident manager at a hotel, reported the sighting and completed the questionnaire in October 1958.
sighted object: two extremely bright and star-like objects
witnesses: civilian resident manager at a hotel
